column4: Hey everyone, I seem to be having a bit of a problem. My memory usage is bizarrely high, and I've already checked all running processes. Nothing could possibly be using this much memory.
if you bring up system monitor, and check the virtual memory colum . . . do you see anything?
I don't see a virtual memory column.
goto Edit > Preferences in the system monitor
and the little list in the bottom of the box, you can put a check box in virtual memory
Okay, I enabled it. A lot is being used by Epiphany, but I already cleared the cache for it.
does it appear to be the culprit? ie the exessive use you mentioned?
Yeah. Nearly 200 MB being used up.
do you have many web pages open in it?
No. Only one page running, and I cleared the cache.
if you change that to a simple page like www.google.com does the memory amount remain that high?
Yes. Only lowers by about 20 MB, but still high.
do you like ephinany that much? don't want to use firefox or opera ?
I'm on Epiphany because I'm trying to reduce my memory usage, but for some reason it's actually using more. What the heck.
ah i see, i read something somewhere i can't remmeber . lemmie seee . . .
I tried using Opera a few times but got annoyed because I was so used to Firefox, which I've been using for years now. Epiphany was similar enough, so I tried it out. Any other good pseudo-Firefoxes?
